security_audit.summary: All 26 static findings are false positives. This is a pure role-playing narrative script with no code execution, network calls, or file system access. The static analyzer misinterpreted GitHub URLs as network threats, SHA256 hashes as weak crypto, and markdown code fences as shell commands.

content.value_statement: Guide astronaut Stella through the ruins of a fallen alien civilization. Discover lost technology, unravel historical mysteries, and make ethical choices that shape the story.
actual_capabilities: Guide Stella through 5 exploration stages with branching narratives
Decode ancient pictograms revealing civilization history
Interact with alien technology and holographic recordings
Make ethical decisions about knowledge and cultural respect
Experience 3 distinct story endings based on player choices
Explore themes of civilization rise, fall, and planetary consciousness
limitations: No persistent state between separate conversations
Cannot generate images or multimedia content
Limited to the preset story structure and dialogue paths

use_cases.title: Explore alien mysteries
use_cases.description: Discover the secrets of a fallen alien civilization through immersive dialogue and exploration.

use_cases.title: Study narrative structure
use_cases.description: Learn how branching narratives and environmental storytelling create engaging interactive fiction.

use_cases.title: Practice conversational English
use_cases.description: Read natural astronaut dialogue mixing Chinese and English in context.

prompt_templates.title: Start exploration
prompt_templates.prompt: Stella, tell me what you see at the entrance of the ancient ruins.

prompt_templates.title: Read ancient history
prompt_templates.prompt: What story does the mosaic on the ground tell? What happened to this civilization?

prompt_templates.title: Investigate technology
prompt_templates.prompt: Describe what you find in the technology hall. Is any of it still active?

prompt_templates.title: Make ethical choice
prompt_templates.prompt: The central crystal contains immense knowledge. What do you decide to do? Should you take it?

output_examples.input: Stella, tell me what you see at the entrance of the ancient ruins.
output: This... this is a city... an entire ancient city!
Buildings stretch for kilometers, most collapsed, covered in purple-blue vegetation. But some structures still stand tall with geometric domes and archways that defy gravity.

The streets are paved with glowing crystals that still emit faint light after thousands of years. I touch a pillar - the material is smooth and cold, neither stone nor metal, but something in between.
The walls are covered in pictograms, much more detailed than what I saw in the cave. This must have been a library... the entire city was a monument to knowledge.
The mosaic tells a six-part story. Panel 1 shows the Eos species evolving on this planet from simple beginnings.
Panel 2 shows them discovering the power of crystals and learning to harness energy.
Panel 3 is their golden age - cities, art, science, and reaching for the stars.
Then Panel 4 turns dark - the sky turns red, the two suns flickering. A stellar event!
Panel 5 shows catastrophe - buildings falling, Eos fleeing, death and destruction.
Panel 6 shows few survivors hiding and rebuilding slowly, but their glory lost forever.

output_examples.input: Should you take the central crystal?
output: The crystal pulses with ancient knowledge and power. Taking it back to Earth could advance humanity by centuries.
But the Eos desperately gesture for me to stop. They explain through their device that the crystal is an anchor, that Gaia will be angry, that the city could fall again.
This is the ethical dilemma - scientific curiosity versus cultural respect, progress versus preservation.
The choice shapes which ending I experience and what kind of guardian of this knowledge I become.

best_practices: Let Stella guide you through each stage before moving to the next story beat.
Ask follow-up questions about artifacts and discoveries for deeper narrative detail.
Consider both scientific curiosity and ethical implications when making choices.
anti_patterns: Rushing through multiple stages without appreciating the environmental storytelling.
Ignoring the ethical dimensions of discovery and cultural respect.
Treating Stella as a tool rather than engaging with her character development.

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for interactive role-play sessions.

faq.question: How long does the chapter take to complete?
faq.answer: Approximately 35-45 minutes depending on how thoroughly you explore and question Stella.

faq.question: Can I combine this with other chapters?
faq.answer: Yes, recommended chapters include daily-science, escape-plan, and alien-encounter for a complete experience.

faq.question: Is my data stored anywhere?
faq.answer: No, this is a prompt-based skill with no data storage or network connections.

faq.question: Why does Stella mix Chinese and English?
faq.answer: This reflects her character background as a Chinese-American astronaut, adding authenticity.

faq.question: How many endings are there?
faq.answer: Three main endings: Archaeologist, Discoverer, and Revelation, based on your choices and discoveries.
